meta_description: The Andrew Low House Museum in Savannah, GA is a nationally known 1840s historic home and garden situated on one of the most beautiful Savannah historic sites.
hours_text:
* * *

# Visit

The Andrew Low House Museum is consistently named one of Savannah’s top attractions. Nestled in the heart of the Historic District, it’s a must-see destination!

## Admission & Hours

Plan for your visit by purchasing your Museum tickets in advance, viewing our hours of operation, viewing tour information, and more. Learn about the history of Andrew Low House — visit today!

[LEARN MORE](http://web.archive.org/web/20251107180426/https://www.andrewlowhouse.com/visit/admission-hours/)

## Getting Here

Get directions to Andrew Low House Museum, located on Lafayette Square. Located one block from the Cathedral Basilica of St. John the Baptist and only a few blocks from Forsyth Park. Prepare for your visit with helpful information about entering the Museum and parking.

[LEARN MORE](http://web.archive.org/web/20251107180426/https://www.andrewlowhouse.com/visit/getting-here/)

## Groups & Tours

Interested in scheduling a group visit or a specialized tour? The Andrew Low House Museum welcomes you and can accommodate various group sizes and special interests. Learn more and reserve your group tours today!

[LEARN MORE](http://web.archive.org/web/20251107180426/https://www.andrewlowhouse.com/visit/groups-tours/)

## The Museum Shop

Find a unique gift for every occasion in the Museum Shop! 

[LEARN MORE](http://web.archive.org/web/20251107180426/https://www.andrewlowhouse.com/visit/museum-shop/)

# Andrew Low House Museum

Stunning from the outside, breathtaking within, our history will inspire you. Come explore this beautiful 19th century home in the heart of Savannah’s National Historic Landmark District.

## Experience History

Situated on one of the most beautiful sites in Savannah, and less than one block from the Cathedral Basilica of St. John the Baptist, the Andrew Low House Museum is a nationally known 1840s historic home and garden. Come and experience our stories, our collections, and our home.

[BUY TICKETS](http://web.archive.org/web/20260105084919/https://www.etix.com/ticket/e/1019082/andrew-low-house-museum-admissions-savannah-andrew-low-house-museum)

* * *

## Discover a Savannah Gem

Imagine Savannah in the 1840s as an active and thriving seaport. A young Scottish immigrant named Andrew Low II became one of the most successful businessmen in Georgia. Juliette Gordon Low, Andrew’s daughter-in-law, lived here during the early years of the Girl Scouts. Now, a historic gem, the home along with its furnishings and its garden, is a must-see destination on any trip to Savannah.

[LEARN MORE](http://web.archive.org/web/20260105084919/https://www.andrewlowhouse.com/visit/)

## Discover the Stories

Hear the stories of the Low family and learn about the enslaved men and women who lived and labored at the site....
